timeline.bodyText:
Feels like this ApiKeyRepository is a bit different from the conventions used in other repositories. Other repositories mostly

have a saveOrUpdate method which is used for both creating and updating
do not deletegate simple update / delete operations to DAO, but instead just use direct calls with persistenceUtils, e.g. 
  
    
      X-Road/src/proxy-ui-api/src/main/java/org/niis/xroad/restapi/repository/LocalGroupRepository.java
    
    
        Lines 104 to 106
      in
      735e853
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public void delete(LocalGroupType localGroupType) { 
        

        
          
               persistenceUtils.getCurrentSession().delete(localGroupType); 
        

        
          
           } 
        
    
  



But this is earlier legacy than this ticket so nothing has to be done here. I think I will add a few lines to confluence to offer some conventions for future repository implementations.
I think I will pick an API key related ticket next, so I might refactor this part there. Or, if you get the inspiration, you can do it also.

replies.bodyText: I got inspired and did some refactoring. As a result the implementation now follows the same structure with other endpoints. Repository and service layers are separated, and business logic is implemented in the service layer.
